TopicTitle: Sukhoi T 50 PAK FA replica DOWNLOAD

Articles.Content:
Sukhoi T 50 PAK FA

Hi! I have finished my PAK FA replica, it took a long long time to build it, so i hope you like it

Full stock and coloured with kerbpaint in black and white, but you can change it if you don't like black.

Part count: 250

weight at take off: about 13 tons

fuel load: 300

highly manouverable even without SAS

hidden ladder

CONTROLS

-1 toggle engines

-0 toggle ladder

Javascript is disabled. View full album

DOWNLOAD FOR KSP 0.90

KERBPAINT: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50008-0-23-KerbPaint-Paint-layering-for-parts-%28September-23rd%29-%28Same-Old-Still-Works!%29

NEW PARTS FOR KERBPAINT: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B8M97OfrN8YrVHVCcDFCZTRYT0k/view credits to Manwith Noname

If you like my crafts please rep me or comment

NEW BDarmory version

DOWNLOAD (requires BDarmory)

Perhaps my favorite Eorin's replica !
Nice one bro!

I thought that it was awesome, just that it was a tad slow at 3/4 speed during turns and stuff. At full speed it was amazing, but it left everything else in the dust. Other than that, awesome build! totally looks like the real thing

-Icklewiwi

Perhaps my favorite Eorin's replica !

Even better than my YF-12? XD
Yup ! I'm not a big fan of replicas, generally speaking, but I like this one
cant rep you.....WHY FORUMS WHY?!?!??!!?!?

UPDATE: modified the front profile of wings with a canard to add a nice movement effect, a better look and more manouverability

download on main post
Great work looks good

That is the smoothest FAR graph I've ever seen . Also cabling performs really well, the plane turns like if it was in stock ksp LOL

Nice work

Edited December 16, 2014 by RevanCorana
Perfect!

Perfect!

thx =) i will add a 0.90 version soon with a better shape
Btw is it necessary to have so big part count? Can't you do anything with that?

Btw is it necessary to have so big part count? Can't you do anything with that?

honestly i think no, the new patch add more wooble to the plane so i really can t reduce the part count without compromise the overall rigidity, but im working on this now so lets see what happen =)

honestly i think no, the new patch add more wooble to the plane so i really can t reduce the part count without compromise the overall rigidity, but im working on this now so lets see what happen =)

I achieved some structural stability on my F-15 under 200 parts by attaching some of the central fuselage to structural components.

It also took some creative wing design, but balancing the airframe is half the fun.

Also, it seems single engine jets are actually easier to make. My Mirage-III doesn't experience any wobbling.

Should I abandon installing internal bomb bays on my stealth jet replicas? It certainly screwed up the shape on my YF-22.

Edited December 16, 2014 by andrew123

I achieved some structural stability on my F-15 under 200 parts by attaching some of the central fuselage to structural components.

It also took some creative wing design, but balancing the airframe is half the fun.

Also, it seems single engine jets are actually easier to make. My Mirage-III doesn't experience any wobbling.

The problem is for achieve such a good shape i didn't use any fuselage, it's just 1 wing connector, 1 central bar and then wings to recreate the fuselage so it can be very rigid without a lot of struts...

I agree single anegine are way to easy to manage, double engine are harder especially when they have thrust vectoring that add a lot of torque to the structure of the plane, the pak fa has even the two engines pretty distant each other, and this add even more torque.

The new version has about 260 parts, but all are necessary sadly, so im still happy because it looks even better than before
